items.text: works it into the leg side, past midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, 1 run

items.text: extra bounce as Mehidy hits a good length outside off and surprises Hope who is trying to flick the ball to midwicket and has to yank his bottom hand off the bat
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: flicks through midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: drives smoothly to long-on
items.postText: mas: "talking about shai strike rate think he has vastly improved and best as opener with the powerplay allows him to get going earlier. doesnt he hold the record for fastest t20i 50 by westindian 16 balls vs BD on slow decks in Bd. also made 88 from 45 in cpl match"
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, 1 run

items.text: inside edge as Chase stays too upright while playing away from his body. The shot meant to skirt away through the covers goes instead to long leg
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Chase, 1 run

items.text: good length ball on middle, Hope blocks and demands the single, but again he's met with an answer in the negative
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.preText: Chris: "The tracks in England will be absolute belters! Two reasons for it, firstly, I think England believe no one can outscore them and secondly because they want to appeal more to casuals who want to see high scoring games (t20 style) "
items.text: top edge but it lobs over the short fine leg fielder. The mis-hit is because Hope is into the pull shot too early and the short ball nearly does the trick
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.text: adjusts to Jayed's limited pace better as he now rocks back and across and cuts to deep point
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Chase, 1 run

items.text: stops on him and Hope nearly pops a return catch. Jayed's ability to keep it wicket to wicket will give him reward sooner or later
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: slower ball on off stump, Hope dabs it towards point and sprints through. Good response from Chase too
items.postText: Andrew Brooks: "All this chat about English pitches - remember the ICC determine pitches for a WC, not England." --- True, and they were only too happy to see, what, three double-hundreds in the last World Cup? Bowlers, prepare for the worst.
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.text: looks to drive towards long-on, but Mehidy's drift secures a bit of a leading edge back to him
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: loops it up outside off, Hope lunges forward and across to block
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: picks the flatter trajectory early, going back to flick the ball through square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: shimmies down the pitch but Mehidy pulls his length back just enough that Chase's flick is mistimed, and almost carries to midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, no run

items.text: good length ball outside off, defends to cover
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, no run

items.text: whips the full delivery on leg stump away to deep midwicket. Outstanding shot, especially seeing as he yanked his front foot back, which is right where the ball pitched, to open up room for the shot
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, 2 runs

items.text: defends a fullish delivery on off stump back at the bowler
items.postText: Aj: "I hope we back Bravo for the whole WC, he's way too good to be left out "
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, no run

items.text: lifts a fuller delivery on middle away to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Hope, 1 run

items.text: goes for the on the up drive but Jayed doesn't really have the pace for those shots and it shows, mistimed hit to cover
items.postText: Jordan: "Making ODIs run-fests will be their demise. The most consistently interesting one dayers to watch are at Associate level (even if the quality isn't quite as high) because scores are much more variable, and quality across the board is fairly even."
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Chase, no run

items.text: eases the shortish delivery outside off to point
items.postText: Don: "Suddenly 300 is looking a long way off for the windies"
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Chase, no run

items.text: full and outside off, bunts it back down the pitch
items.postText: Seth: "Chris, what you say about England being able to outscore any team may be true, but I'm pretty sure there are teams that can outbowl them. I think that is their main worry. If their batters are contained by good bowling they will start looking for release shots, and if those don't come off then their game plan could be in danger. (caveat these this is just my opinion :)" --- Jofra Archer might have something to say about that.
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Chase, no run

items.text: punches a length ball down the ground to long-on
items.shortText: Abu Jayed to Chase, 1 run

items.text: gets the dip just right and the flick that Hope intends to keep along the ground goes in the air through midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, 1 run

items.text: rocks back to punch the short ball outside off to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: goes back to force the ball down the ground, but hits straight to the bowler
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, no run
